page.title: 16TRAFFIC IN DAISY HILL (CONT)
page.content:
THE LEAST WAS ONE YEAR, AND THE MOST WAS THIRTY YEARS.
TWENTY PEOPLE THOUGHT THAT IN THE LAST FEW YEARS, THE{ROADS IN DAISY HILL}HAD CARRIED A LOT MORE TRAFFIC, AND TWELVE NOTICED IT CONSISTED OF MOSTLY PRIVATE CARS, MOTORBIKES AND HEAVY LORRIES. MOST OF THE PEOPLE THOUGHT THE{ROADS {WERE DANGEROUS,}AND TEN PEOPLE SAID THAT THE TRAFFIC WAS VERY{NOISY.
TWENTY PEOPLE THOUGHT THAT{PARKING}WAS A PROBLEM IN DAISY HILL. SOME OF THE PEOPLE WHO WERE INTERVIEWED THOUGHT THAT{CROSSING ROADS}WAS A PROBLEM, AND SO WAS THE{CONGESTION.} ALSO PEOPLE THOUGHT THAT THE ROADS THEMSELVES WERE IN POOR CONDITION.
(CONTINUED ON PAGE 17)
